Properties

stepLBound

stepLBound: number = 0.00001
  • Defined in davinci-newton/solvers/AdaptiveStepSolver.ts:17

The smallest time step that will executed. Setting a reasonable lower bound prevents the solver from taking too long to give up.

stepUBound

stepUBound: number = 1
  • Defined in davinci-newton/solvers/AdaptiveStepSolver.ts:12

Accessors

secondDiff

  • get secondDiff(): boolean
  • set secondDiff(value: boolean): void
    • Defined in davinci-newton/solvers/AdaptiveStepSolver.ts:103

    Returns whether to use second order differences for deciding when to reduce the step size. i.e. whether to use change in change in energy as the criteria for accuracy.

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in davinci-newton/solvers/AdaptiveStepSolver.ts:125

    Whether to use second order differences for deciding when to reduce the step size. The first difference is the change in energy of the system over a time step. We can only use first differences when the energy of the system is constant. If the energy of the system changes over time, then we need to reduce the step size until the change of energy over the step stabilizes. Put another way: we reduce the step size until the change in the change in energy becomes small.

    Parameters

    • value: boolean

      true means use change in change in energy (second derivative) as the criteria for accuracy

    Returns void

tolerance

  • get tolerance(): number
  • set tolerance(value: number): void
    • Defined in davinci-newton/solvers/AdaptiveStepSolver.ts:111

    Returns the tolerance used to decide if sufficient accuracy has been achieved. Default is 1E-6.

    Returns number

    • Defined in davinci-newton/solvers/AdaptiveStepSolver.ts:135

    Sets the tolerance used to decide if sufficient accuracy has been achieved. Default is 1E-6.

    Parameters

    • value: number

      the tolerance value for deciding if sufficient accuracy has been achieved

    Returns void
